  16. (* The "trace" facility *)

  18. open Format
  19. open Misc
  20. open Longident
  21. open Types
  22. open Topeval
  23. open Topcommon

  25. ‌type codeptr = Obj.raw_data

  27. ‌type traced_function =
  28.   { path: Path.t;                       (* Name under which it is traced *)
  29.     closure: Obj.t;                     (* Its function closure (patched) *)
  30.     actual_code: codeptr;               (* Its original code pointer *)
  31.     instrumented_fun: codeptr -> Obj.t -> Obj.t -> Obj.t }
  32.                                         (* Printing function *)

  34. ‌let traced_functions = ref ([] : traced_function list)

  36. (* Check if a function is already traced *)

  38. ‌let is_traced clos =
  39.   let rec is_traced = function
  40.       [] -> None
  41.     | tf :: rem -> if tf.closure == clos then Some tf.path else is_traced rem
  42.   in is_traced !traced_functions

  44. (* Get or overwrite the code pointer of a closure *)

  46. ‌let get_code_pointer cls =
  47.   assert (let t = Obj.tag cls in t = Obj.closure_tag || t = Obj.infix_tag);
  48.   Obj.raw_field cls 0

  50. ‌let set_code_pointer cls ptr =
  51.   assert (let t = Obj.tag cls in t = Obj.closure_tag || t = Obj.infix_tag);
  52.   Obj.set_raw_field cls 0 ptr

  54. (* Call a traced function (use old code pointer, but new closure as
  55.    environment so that recursive calls are also traced).
  56.    It is necessary to wrap Meta.invoke_traced_function in an ML function
  57.    so that the RETURN at the end of the ML wrapper takes us to the
  58.    code of the function. *)

  60. ‌let invoke_traced_function codeptr env arg =
  61.   Meta.invoke_traced_function codeptr env arg

  63. ‌let print_label ppf l =
  64.   if l <> Asttypes.Nolabel then fprintf ppf "%s:" (Printtyp.string_of_label l)

  66. (* If a function returns a functional value, wrap it into a trace code *)

  68. ‌let rec instrument_result env name ppf clos_typ =
  69.   match get_desc (Ctype.expand_head env clos_typ) with
  70.   | Tarrow(l, t1, t2, _) ->
  71.       let starred_name =
  72.         match name with
  73.         | Lident s -> Lident(s ^ "*")
  74.         | Ldot(lid, s) -> Ldot(lid, s ^ "*")
  75.         | Lapply _ -> fatal_error "Trace.instrument_result" in
  76.       let trace_res = instrument_result env starred_name ppf t2 in
  77.       (fun clos_val ->
  78.         Obj.repr (fun arg ->
  79.           if not !may_trace then
  80.             (Obj.magic clos_val : Obj.t -> Obj.t) arg
  81.           else begin
  82.             may_trace := false;
  83.             try
  84.               fprintf ppf "@[<2>%a <--@ %a%a@]@."
  85.                 Printtyp.longident starred_name
  86.                 print_label l
  87.                 (print_value !toplevel_env arg) t1;
  88.               may_trace := true;
  89.               let res = (Obj.magic clos_val : Obj.t -> Obj.t) arg in
  90.               may_trace := false;
  91.               fprintf ppf "@[<2>%a -->@ %a@]@."
  92.                 Printtyp.longident starred_name
  93.                 (print_value !toplevel_env res) t2;
  94.               may_trace := true;
  95.               trace_res res
  96.             with exn ->
  97.               may_trace := false;
  98.               fprintf ppf "@[<2>%a raises@ %a@]@."
  99.                 Printtyp.longident starred_name
  100.                 (print_value !toplevel_env (Obj.repr exn)) Predef.type_exn;
  101.               may_trace := true;
  102.               raise exn
  103.           end))
  104.   | _ -> (fun v -> v)

  106. (* Same as instrument_result, but for a toplevel closure (modified in place) *)

  108. exception Dummy
  109. let _ = Dummy

  111. let instrument_closure env name ppf clos_typ =
  112.   match get_desc (Ctype.expand_head env clos_typ) with
  113.   | Tarrow(l, t1, t2, _) ->
  114.       let trace_res = instrument_result env name ppf t2 in
  115.       (fun actual_code closure arg ->
  116.         if not !may_trace then begin
  117.           try invoke_traced_function actual_code closure arg
  118.           with Dummy -> assert false
  119.           (* do not remove handler, prevents tail-call to invoke_traced_ *)
  120.         end else begin
  121.           may_trace := false;
  122.           try
  123.             fprintf ppf "@[<2>%a <--@ %a%a@]@."
  124.               Printtyp.longident name
  125.               print_label l
  126.               (print_value !toplevel_env arg) t1;
  127.             may_trace := true;
  128.             let res = invoke_traced_function actual_code closure arg in
  129.             may_trace := false;
  130.             fprintf ppf "@[<2>%a -->@ %a@]@."
  131.               Printtyp.longident name
  132.               (print_value !toplevel_env res) t2;
  133.             may_trace := true;
  134.             trace_res res
  135.           with exn ->
  136.             may_trace := false;
  137.             fprintf ppf "@[<2>%a raises@ %a@]@."
  138.               Printtyp.longident name
  139.               (print_value !toplevel_env (Obj.repr exn)) Predef.type_exn;
  140.             may_trace := true;
  141.             raise exn
  142.         end)
  143.   | _ -> assert false

  145. (* Given the address of a closure, find its tracing info *)

  147. ‌let rec find_traced_closure clos = function
  148.   | [] -> fatal_error "Trace.find_traced_closure"
  149.   | f :: rem -> if f.closure == clos then f else find_traced_closure clos rem

  151. (* Trace the application of an (instrumented) closure to an argument *)

  153. ‌let print_trace clos arg =
  154.   let f = find_traced_closure clos !traced_functions in
  155.   f.instrumented_fun f.actual_code clos arg
